etymology.description: 亡(亡) (wáng, "lose") + 川(川) (chuān, "river") = phonetic 亡 + semantic 川 -> vast emptiness
etymology.interpretation: 巟(巟) (huāng, "vast emptiness") combines 亡(亡) (wáng, "lose"), which phoneticizes the character, with 川(川) (chuān, "river"), signifying the vastness akin to the wide and open nature of a river valley. The combination suggests an expansive or empty space, connecting to the meaning of emptiness.
